summary: Frontend implements a two-step Internet Identity sign-up flow with Full Name + Email form, validation, and dashboard navigation. A new BasicProfile type and a frontend hook calling `actor.saveBasicProfile` were added. However, the diff summary truncation prevents confirming that the backend actually implements `saveBasicProfile` and that it persists into the existing `userProfiles` map without breaking existing profile methods. Additionally, a summary file describes multiple unrelated UI/route changes not requested.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend: add a dedicated method to store a basic user profile (Full Name + Email) in the existing `userProfiles` map keyed by `caller`, without breaking existing `getCallerUserProfile` / `saveCallerUserProfile` behavior.
missing_requirements.reason: Frontend calls `actor.saveBasicProfile(...)`, but the backend diff is truncated before showing any implementation of a `saveBasicProfile` method or confirming it writes into the existing `userProfiles` map while preserving existing behaviors.
evidence: backend/main.mo (truncated at `public shared ({ caller }) func save ...`)

hallucinated_features.description: Documentation/summary indicates many unrelated frontend changes (branding layout/header/footer, payment routes, OTP demo component, contact page rewrite, pricing page payment mentions, etc.) that were not requested as part of the sign-up/account creation flow work.
hallucinated_features.reason: These changes are not part of REQ-1/REQ-2/REQ-3 and are only mentioned in the modified `frontend-file-summaries.txt`, suggesting scope creep (at least in documented changes).
